com.github.sanity4j.model.diagnostic

Class Diagnostic

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.sanity4j.model.diagnostic.Diagnostic

  • public class Diagnostic
extends java.lang.Object
    Diagnostic - represents a diagnostic message that has been generated from one of the QA tools.
    Since:
    Sanity4J 1.0
    Author:
    Yiannis Paschalidis

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SEVERITY_ALL
      Any severity.
      static int SEVERITY_HIGH
      High priority - e.g.
      static int SEVERITY_INFO
      Information-only - for advice to junior developers.

      Low priority - e.g.

      Any source.

      A Diagnostic sourced from Checkstyle.

      A Diagnostic sourced from PMD.

        Any source.

      • SOURCE_OTHER

        public static final int SOURCE_OTHER
        A Diagnostic sourced from an undefined tool. Should not occur.

      • SEVERITY_ALL

        public static final int SEVERITY_ALL
        Any severity.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SEVERITY_INFO

        public static final int SEVERITY_INFO
        Information-only - for advice to junior developers.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SEVERITY_LOW

        public static final int SEVERITY_LOW
        Low priority - e.g. formatting issues.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SEVERITY_MODERATE

        public static final int SEVERITY_MODERATE
        Moderate priority - e.g. hard to understand code.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SEVERITY_SIGNIFICANT

        public static final int SEVERITY_SIGNIFICANT
        Significant priority - e.g. Probable NullPointerException.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SEVERITY_HIGH

        public static final int SEVERITY_HIGH
        High priority - e.g. calling System.exit from a Web-app.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • getCategories

        public java.lang.String[] getCategories()
        Returns the categories of this diagnostic, based upon the source and ruleName. The categories are read from Diagnostic.properties.
        Returns:
        the categories of this diagnostic

      • calcSeverity

        public void calcSeverity()
        Calculates the severity based on the Diagnostic.properties.

      • isExcluded

        public boolean isExcluded()
        Should this diagnostic be excluded from the report? This is controlled by the Diagnostic.properties file, as some of the tools don't support exclusions by class + rule.
        Returns:
        true if the diagnostic should be excluded
